qas.question: When was the first effective treatment for Tuberculosis discovered?
Who was Eli Lilly's work based off of?
50% of tuberculosis-infected people died within 5 years where?
What was the first treatment for tuberculosis?
What percentage of patients infected with tuberculosis died within 5 years?
In what year was streptomycin discovered?
Many more antibiotics were made following the end of what war?
What company funded the research that led to the discovery of streptomycin?
When was the first effective treatment for Streptomycin discovered?
Who was Eli Smith's work based off of?
50% of tuberculosis-infected people died within 3 years where?
What was the first treatment of drugs?

context: The aftermath of <a8_0>World War II<a8_0/> saw an explosion in the discovery of new classes of antibacterial drugs including the cephalosporins (developed by Eli Lilly based on the seminal work of <a2_0><b12_0>Giuseppe Brotzu and Edward Abraham<b12_0/><a2_0/>), streptomycin (discovered during a <a9_0>Merck<a9_0/>-funded research program in Selman Waksman's laboratory), the tetracyclines (discovered at <a3_0>Lederle Laboratories<a3_0/>, now a part of Pfizer), erythromycin (discovered at Eli Lilly and Co.) and their extension to an increasingly wide range of bacterial pathogens. <a1_0><a5_0><b11_0><b14_0>Streptomycin<b14_0/><b11_0/><a5_0/><a1_0/>, discovered during a Merck-funded research program in Selman Waksman's laboratory at Rutgers in <a0_0><a7_0><b10_0>1943<b10_0/><a7_0/><a0_0/>, became the first effective treatment for tuberculosis. At the time of its discovery, sanitoriums for the isolation of tuberculosis-infected people were an ubiquitous feature of <a4_0><b13_0>cities in developed countries<b13_0/><a4_0/>, with <a6_0>50%<a6_0/> dying within 5 years of admission.
